item.p: My body cast a shadow over the grass.
item.a2: The grass was cut.

item.p: The woman tolerated her friend's difficult behavior.
item.a1: The woman knew her friend was going through a hard time.
item.a2: The woman felt that her friend took advantage of her kindness.

item.p: The women met for coffee.
item.a1: The cafe reopened in a new location.
item.a2: They wanted to catch up with each other.

item.p: The runner wore shorts.
item.a2: She planned to run along the beach.

item.p: The guests of the party hid behind the couch.
item.a2: It was a birthday party.

item.p: The politician lost the election.
item.a2: No one voted for him.

item.p: The stain came out of the shirt.
item.a2: I bleached the shirt.

item.p: The man got a discount on his groceries.
item.a2: He used a coupon.

item.p: The physician misdiagnosed the patient.
item.a1: The patient filed a malpractice lawsuit against the physician.
item.a2: The patient disclosed confidential information to the physician.

item.p: The customer filed a complaint with the store manager.
item.a1: The sales associate undercharged the customer.
item.a2: The sales associate acted rude to the customer.

item.p: The woman repaired her faucet.
item.a2: The faucet was turned off.

item.p: The elderly woman suffered a stroke.
item.a1: The woman's daughter came over to clean her house.
item.a2: The woman's daughter moved in to take care of her.

item.p: The pond froze over for the winter.
item.a2: People brought boats to the pond.

item.p: The offender violated parole.
item.a1: She was sent back to jail.
item.a2: She stole money from a church.

item.p: I poured water on my sleeping friend.
item.a2: My friend snored.

item.p: The girl gasped.
item.a1: Her friend stuck an ice cube down her back.
item.a2: Her friend gave her a pat on the back.

item.p: The shirt shrunk.
item.a2: I put it in the dryer.

item.p: It got dark outside.
item.a1: Snowflakes began to fall from the sky.
item.a2: The moon became visible in the sky.

item.p: I hung up the phone.
item.a1: The caller said goodbye to me.
item.a2: The caller identified himself to me.

item.p: The woman's ring slipped off in the shower.
item.a2: The ring went down the drain.

item.p: The girl received a trophy.
item.a2: She made a new friend.

item.p: The woman's date wanted to look like a gentleman.
item.a1: He opened the door for her.
item.a2: He asked her if she liked sushi.

item.p: The farmland needed irrigation.
item.a2: A flood occurred.

item.p: The host cancelled the party.
item.a1: She was certain she had the flu.
item.a2: She worried she would catch the flu.

item.p: The woman gave the man her phone number.
item.a2: She was repulsed by him.

item.p: The skydiver glided safely to the ground.
item.a2: She jumped out of the plane.

item.p: The toddler became cranky.
item.a1: Her mother put her down for a nap.
item.a2: Her mother fixed her hair into pigtails.

item.p: The child became immune to the disease.
item.a1: He avoided exposure to the disease.
item.a2: He received the vaccine for the disease.

item.p: The grape juice fermented.
item.a2: The juice evaporated.

item.p: The friends' debate dragged on interminably.
item.a1: The friends saw eye to eye.
item.a2: The friends were splitting hairs.

item.p: The woman hummed to herself.
item.a2: She was in a good mood.

item.p: The man hated his new haircut.
item.a2: He grew a beard.

item.p: The police aimed their weapons at the fugitive.
item.a1: The fugitive fell to the ground.
item.a2: The fugitive dropped his gun.

item.p: The patient was dehydrated.
item.a2: The nurse gave him an IV.

item.p: The girl found the missing puzzle piece.
item.a2: She took apart the puzzle.

item.p: The man urgently leaped out of bed.
item.a1: He wanted to shut off the alarm clock.
item.a2: He wanted to iron his pants before work.

item.p: The papers were disorganized.
item.a2: I put them into alphabetical order.

item.p: The woman won the lottery.
item.a2: She joined a church.

item.p: The seamstress pushed the threaded needle into the fabric.
item.a1: The thread wrapped around the needle.
item.a2: The thread went through the fabric.

item.p: The woman hired a lawyer.
item.a1: She decided to sue her employer.
item.a2: She decided to run for office.

item.p: The tenant misplaced his keys to his apartment.
item.a2: His landlord repaired the door.

item.p: My favorite song came on the radio.
item.a2: I sang along to it.

item.p: The executive decided not to hire the applicant.
item.a1: The applicant failed a background check.
item.a2: The applicant had experience for the job.

item.p: The man's eye became infected.
item.a2: He put on glasses.

item.p: The bird couldn't fly.
item.a2: It injured its wing.

item.p: The girl made a wish.
item.a2: She saw a shooting star.
